Solar_Panel.name: Solar Panel
Solar_Panel.description: Flexible thin-film solar panel with high-efficiency photovoltaic cells and lightweight materials

embodiment.description: Lightweight solar panel with advanced materials and design

physics_models.name: Solar Irradiance Model
physics_models.python_code:
from sympy import symbols, Eq, solve
P, eta, A, G = symbols('P eta A G')
Eq(P, eta * A * G)
physics_models.coder_notes: P = power, η = efficiency, A = area, G = irradiance

Water_Pump.name: Water Pump
Water_Pump.description: DC pump with advanced motor technology and compact design

embodiment.description: Lightweight water pump with compact design

physics_models.name: Pump Performance Model
physics_models.python_code:
from sympy import symbols, Eq, solve
Q, eta, P, delta_p = symbols('Q eta P delta_p')
Eq(Q, eta * P * delta_p)
physics_models.coder_notes: Q = flow rate, η = efficiency, P = power, Δp = pressure difference

Filter_Module.name: Filter Module
Filter_Module.description: Advanced ceramic filter with activated carbon and compact design

embodiment.description: Lightweight filter module with compact design

physics_models.name: Filtration Performance Model
physics_models.python_code:
from sympy import symbols, Eq, solve
C_out, C_in, eta = symbols('C_out C_in eta')
Eq(C_out, C_in * (1 - eta))
physics_models.coder_notes: C_out = output concentration, C_in = input concentration, η = removal efficiency

Control_Unit.name: Control Unit
Control_Unit.description: Microcontroller with high-performance processing and data analytics and compact design

embodiment.description: Lightweight control unit with compact design

physics_models.name: Control Unit Performance Model
physics_models.python_code:
from sympy import symbols, Eq, solve
T, eta, P, delta_t = symbols('T eta P delta_t')
Eq(T, eta * P * delta_t)
physics_models.coder_notes: T = processing time, η = efficiency, P = power, Δt = time step

Battery.name: Battery
Battery.description: Lithium-ion battery with advanced battery management system and compact design

physics_models.name: Battery Performance Model
physics_models.python_code:
from sympy import symbols, Eq, solve
E, eta, P, delta_t = symbols('E eta P delta_t')
Eq(E, eta * P * delta_t)
physics_models.coder_notes: E = energy, η = efficiency, P = power, Δt = time step
